title: US Farmers Produce 3.6 Billion Pounds of ALMONDS this Way - Harvesting and Processing

subtasks: Provide consistent water through drip irrigation
Monitor tree health for disease or pests
Prune trees at the beginning of winter
Bring honey bees into orchards during blooming period
Wait for almonds to mature (5-6 months after pollination)
Use specially designed machines to shake almonds from trees
Dry almonds under sun for about a week
Clean, sort, and shell almonds using advanced machinery
Sort almonds based on size and quality
Package almonds in various forms (whole, sliced, ground)
Distribute packaged almonds to markets and stores
